title: STA-TCN: Neural Decoder for Upper Limb Rehabilitation
image: figures/STA-TCN Neural Decoder for Upper Limb Rehabilitation.png
summary: Continuous motion prediction using sEMG for cable-driven exoskeletons.
description: This project focuses on continuous motion prediction for upper-limb rehabilitation robotics using surface electromyography (sEMG) signals. A Spatio-Temporal Attention and lightweight Temporal Convolutional Network (STA-TCN) architecture was proposed to enable subject-independent, real-time estimation of elbow joint angles.
details:
**Objectives**

• Develop a robust, real-time neural decoding model to estimate elbow joint angles from sEMG signals.
• Eliminate the need for subject-specific calibration by enhancing cross-subject generalization.
• Validate the model's feasibility in controlling a cable-driven upper-limb rehabilitation exoskeleton.

**Role & Duration**

Sep 2024 – Apr 2025 — Project leader & first author: led model design, conducted experiments and data analysis, and coordinated the resulting paper submission.

title: Robotic Catheter System for Cardiac Ablation
image: figures/Robotic Catheter System for Cardiac Ablation.png
summary: Robot-assisted catheter ablation system improving precision, safety and feedback.
description: Development of a robot ablation catheter system for cardiac ablation therapy, aimed at improving the precision, safety and usability of catheter-based treatments for atrial fibrillation. The system integrates advanced sensing, actuation and control components to enhance surgeon-robot interaction during remote procedures.
details:
**Objectives**

• Design a robotic system to support remote-controlled catheter ablation with enhanced precision and feedback.
• Develop two core subsystems: (1) an IMU-based dynamic pose tracker for real-time monitoring of C-arm movement and (2) a motor-based haptic force feedback system simulating tactile resistance.

**Role & Duration**

Jul 2024 – Aug 2024 — Core developer for sensing and feedback systems: designed and implemented the IMU pose-tracking module and built a motor-based haptic feedback system.

title: RRT Motion Planner
summary: Rapidly-exploring random tree motion planner for a manipulator.
description: Course project implementing a rapidly-exploring random tree (RRT) algorithm to plan collision-free paths for a robotic arm. Built a motion planner capable of exploring high-dimensional configuration spaces and generating feasible trajectories for a 6-DOF manipulator.
details:
**Highlights**

Built a motion planner capable of exploring high-dimensional configuration spaces and generating feasible trajectories for a 6-DOF manipulator.

description: Created a robot that uses computer-vision feedback to control a vibrating platform for remote exploration and manipulation tasks. Developed algorithms to track visual markers and adjust vibration patterns in real time, enabling closed-loop control.
details:
**Project Goals**

Developed algorithms to track visual markers and adjust vibration patterns in real time, enabling closed-loop control.

title: Automated Analog IC Layout System
summary: Automated layout generation for matched resistors and capacitors.
description: This project tackles the problem of device mismatch in analog integrated circuits by developing an automated layout generation system for matched resistors and capacitors. Process variation can severely degrade circuit performance in precision modules such as differential amplifiers, current mirrors and filters.
details:
**Overview**

The automated layout tool produces symmetrical placements and routings for matched components, helping analog designers mitigate mismatch without manual intervention.
